definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
to dive (into water)/(sports) diving/to commit suicide by jumping into water/(fig.) (of stock prices etc) to fall dramatically
to jump out/fig. to appear suddenly
to jump from a building (to kill oneself)/fig. to sell at a large discount (in advertising)
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about

sentences.english: They climb walls, leap off buildings and spy on enemies.
sentences.chinese: 它们会爬墙，能跳下大楼，还能暗中监视敌人。

sentences.english: Presently she started up, exclaiming that they wouldbe late for breakfast;
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿她跳了起来，嚷着他们要耽误早饭了。

sentences.english: Learning how to striptease is not difficult.
sentences.chinese: 学习跳脱衣舞十分容易。

sentences.english: Ting Wen before the train, he jumped onto the platform.
sentences.chinese: 火车还没停稳，他就跳上了月台。

sentences.english: It felt like falling headfirst off the top of a 2, 000-foot-tall building.
sentences.chinese: 我的感觉就像是头朝下跳下了两千英尺高的楼。

sentences.english: He jumped onto the table, turned over the cage tried to catch me.
sentences.chinese: 它跳上桌子，把笼子掀倒，企图抓住我。

sentences.english: I jumped as high as I could so that I could won the competition.
sentences.chinese: 我跳得老高，这样的话我就可以赢得比赛了。

sentences.english: Fortunately, Ijurmped back in time to avoid being hit.
sentences.chinese: 很侥幸，我及时往后跳以免费遭撞击。

sentences.english: You’d think an animal that hops would know how to land.
sentences.chinese: 你一定认为会跳的动物就知道如何着地。

sentences.english: Kungfu martial artists learn the jump inside crescent kick in three different parts.
sentences.chinese: 学习功夫武术家内新月形踢三个不同的部分跳。

sentences.english: With that he skipped even higher up the mountain while the wolf loped disappointedly away.
sentences.chinese: 山羊说完就向山上更高的地方跳去，狼失望地跑了。

sentences.english: I say, make time to dance a hop, one hand waving free.
sentences.chinese: 要我说，花点时间为自己跳支舞，一只手在空中挥舞。

sentences.english: She ran outside and danced in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 她跑到外面，在雪地里跳起了舞。

sentences.english: For a few seconds heart plop plop jumped.
sentences.chinese: 对看没几秒心就扑通扑通的跳了。

sentences.english: Eleanor jumps up and down, eager to show off her skills.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉诺跳上蹦下，急着要炫耀她的本领。

sentences.english: To jump over in or as if in leapfrog.
sentences.chinese: 就象跳背游戏中互相跳过。

definition: to hop/to jump on one leg
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
the splits (move in dancing)/to do the splits/Taiwan pr. [pi3 cha1]
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
(slang) to battle each other in street dancing (derived from Taiwanese 較, which sounds similar to Mandarin 尬[ga4])/(slang) to perform weird dance moves
